listing.name: Board Export (Excel, CSV, PDF, Image)
listing.description:
#Quickly and easily export your Trello boards and card information to share insights and boost the visibility of your team‚Äôs work. üöÄ

![Board export demo](https://orahapps-assets.s3.amazonaws.com/BE+Directory+Listing+gif+-+April+2021.gif)

##The most comprehensive and customisable export tool for Trello. Export only what you need with the widest range of Trello field options. Eliminate the need to perform time-consuming editing with a variety of popular export formats. 

##Why export from Trello?

- **Quickly extract** your Trello boards and cards for reporting, analysis, back-up, distribution, and transfer to other systems. 
- **Easily share information** with stakeholders who aren‚Äôt on your Trello board.
- **Save time** by only exporting the information you need. 
- **Engage your audience** by exporting boards into the format suitable for your target audience.
- **Fully supported** and reliable Power-Up with dedicated support and development team.  

>"Board Export has cut my admin time by 50% when creating my reports from Trello" 
>- Matheus, Board Export user

##How can it help you?

Export nearly every Trello data point including boards, cards, comments, activity log, checklists, advanced lists, due dates and members. (NB - supported fields vary between export formats. For a full breakdown [click here](https://docs.adaptavist.com/be/latest/data-included-with-exports) )

![Board Exports in Trello your way](https://hub.adaptavist.com/hubfs/Trello/BE%20-%20your%20way.png)


Fully customisable with the ability to pre-select/deselect the exact fields you want to export. 
![Export only the fields you need with Board Export](https://hub.adaptavist.com/hubfs/Trello/BE%20-%20fields.png)


Export in a variety of formats - Excel, CSV, PDF and image. 
![Variety of external export formats with Board Export](https://hub.adaptavist.com/hubfs/Trello/BE%20-%20formats2.png)
To view an example Trello board click [here](http://bit.ly/3psC9to). And to view the sample export files click: [CSV](https://bit.ly/3xZtsLM), [Excel](https://bit.ly/3uFdC6T), [PDF](https://bit.ly/33wmRKD), [Image](https://bit.ly/2Sz1vKs)


24/7 support team 
![A full support team to help with Board Export](https://hub.adaptavist.com/hubfs/Trello/BE%20-%20support.png)


##Use Cases
üìà  - Share a spreadsheet with clients to update them on your progress. 
‚úâÔ∏è  - Email stakeholders a weekly status report by embedding an image of your board
üóÑÔ∏è  - Maintain an archive of all your lists and cards with a PDF/Excel download
üñºÔ∏è  - Download an image/screenshot of your board to print off or showcase in a presentation

##Pricing
All users start on a 14-day free trial of the Power-up (limited to 5 cards per export) and can upgrade anytime to one of the below plans. 
**Annual billing**: $24/year ($2/month) per user for unlimited Trello boards.
OR
**Monthly billing**: $7.50/month per user for unlimited Trello boards.
(You're purchasing a license key for _one user_, not an entire board's worth of users)
NB: All cards on your board can be exported with this Power-Up, regardless of if you created/are assigned to a card.


##Helpful links 
üìπ  [Video tutorials](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCrqmyoEdH8mMHIIpbEAxTFA)
‚ÑπÔ∏è  [Help centre](https://docs.adaptavist.com/display/_PK/BE/board-export) 


##Legal
By using this Power-Up you agree to our [EULA](https://www.kolekti.com/kolekti-eula), [Terms and Conditions](https://www.theadaptavistgroup.com/policy/terms), and [Privacy Policy](https://www.kolekti.com/privacy-policy).

Learn more about Kolekti and our full suite of Trello Power-Ups [here](https://www.kolekti.com/products/trello).

![By Orah Apps](https://d24o7vf3n2hci.cloudfront.net/img/listings/board-export/trello-listing-pixel.png)
listing.overview: Share select parts of your board with anyone by exporting (by list) as a spreadsheet, PDF or image.

data.text: Documented: it was packaged up for a module system.
I need to confirm this, but I think we accomplished this during migration.
After Nuxt3 upgrade, we are now at 1.5 - all of e2e tests helped me believe we were pretty close (hope they are actually proving something!)
I do believe we are done. All tests (unit/front-end) pass and I have not run into issues. Adjust Gamma is broken, but it has been for a while.
Seems to be mostly done / closed with one exception that wants to upgrade from Nuxt 2 to 4, so I‚Äôm not going to do that yet.
I‚Äôm considering this ‚Äúdone‚Äù. Sure, there‚Äôs more that I want!

data.text: I think ‚Äúframe-rate‚Äù is the auto-paint speed. But it is not obvious.

I don‚Äôt think we have a ‚Äútoo many canvases‚Äù issue.

The ‚Äúextra‚Äù canvas I saw turned out to be the history canvases. Maybe there‚Äôs a more performant way of storing these.

But we should be labeling each canvas for clarity.

data.text: Everything but dependabot prs and the zonal-painting WIP
There‚Äôs forked with a fix for Vue3 - [https://www.npmjs.com/package/@febe95/vue-js-modal](https://www.npmjs.com/package/@febe95/vue-js-modal "smartCard-inline")
More than half the tests are passing, hooray! I‚Äôve updated the version from 1.1.x to 1.2.x in honor of the e2e shenanigans! There‚Äôs more work to be done, but a lot has been done!

card.desc:
in `index.vu`: `


```
  modal(name="textmanager", @closed="start")
    textarea#bodycopy(v-model="currentText")
    .text-controls
      button#applytext(@click="resetTextPosition")
        | Apply text
      button#randomtext(@click="randomText")
        | Random text

  modal(name="about", @closed="start")
    About

  modal(name="help", height="auto", @closed="start", :draggable="true")
    Help

  modal(name="playback", height="500", @closed="start", :draggable="true")
    Playback(
      :pchrome="pchrome",
      :script="script",
      @scriptUpdated="script = $event"
      @capturing="pchrome.params.capturing = $event"
    )
```
card.name: index.vue modals s/b components

card.desc:
Consider this unit and integration testing

There are (as of 2025.07.21)  11 files with 155 tests using vitest. I have not carefully reviewed them for confirmation they make sense. There is a p5-mock that has been created; Gemini tells me the tests are not testing the mock behavior, but other logic. We will see‚Ä¶.
card.name: Introduce some basic testing

card.desc: Consider this unit and integration testing
card.name: Introduce some basic testing

card.desc:
Copilot built a bunch of e2e tests for Playwright, hooray!

I thought they all passed at some point, but then they didn‚Äôt pass.

Going through them, there‚Äôs no way a bunch of them could ever pass ‚Äì they are literally testing behavior that doesn‚Äôt exist or doesn‚Äôt work (ouch!).

And other tests require more scaffolding to work.

It‚Äôs a good process and I‚Äôm making headway.
card.name: e2e testing

card.desc:
```
**Recommended Documentation Additions**

1. **Product Requirements Document (PRD)**: `/docs/requirements/PRD.md`
   - Feature specifications and user stories
   - Design requirements and constraints

2. **Architecture Decision Records (ADRs)**: `/docs/decisions/`
   - Record of major architectural choices
   - Technology selection rationale

3. **User Guide**: `/docs/user-guide/`
   - Tutorial for new users
   - Feature explanations with screenshots
   - Tips and best practices

4. **API Documentation**: `/docs/api/`
   - Internal module interfaces
   - Function signatures and examples

5. **Contributing Guidelines**: `CONTRIBUTING.md`
   - Development setup instructions
   - Code style requirements
   - Pull request process

6. **Changelog**: `CHANGELOG.md`
   - Version history and breaking changes
   - Feature additions and bug fixes

7. **Security Policy**: `SECURITY.md`
   - Security considerations (minimal for this project)
   - Reporting guidelines
```

card.name: UI should not block during long paint operations
UI should not block during long paint operations

card.desc:
IIRC there is no way to set auto-paint speed. Quick operations are quick, slow operations are slow (and lock the UI). It would be nice to be able to stop and backup a couple of paints. But this is close to impossible with quick paint speeds.

UI blocking is another story entirely.
card.name: auto-paint speed

data.text: I think this is the scripting system. So I will consider it closed.

card.name: main sketch is a laaaarge file - break apart
main sketch is a laaaarge file - break apart

old.name: main sketch is a laaaarge file - break apart?

card.name: main sketch is a laaaarge file - break apart

card.desc:
From a Copilot review of sketch.js with the goal of reducing main size:

‚Äå

Transform Operations: Functions like rotateCanvas, flip, mirror, shift, and adjustGamma seem like they could form a "canvas transforms" module. Are these operations conceptually related enough to group together?

Drawing Modes: The three main drawing functions (drawGrid, drawCircle, drawRowCol) and their generators are quite large. Would you prefer to:

Keep them together in a "drawing modes" module, or

Split each mode into its own file (e.g., grid-painter.js, circle-painter.js, rowcol-painter.js)?

Generator Functions: The blocGenerator* functions are currently embedded within drawing functions. Should these be extracted to a separate generators module, or kept with their respective drawing modes?

Canvas Management: There are several canvas/layer utility functions scattered throughout. Would a dedicated canvas utilities module make sense?

Dependencies: Are there any functions that you consider "core" and should definitely stay in the main sketch file? For example, the p5.js lifecycle functions (setup, draw, mousePressed) probably need to stay.
card.name: main sketch is a laaaarge file - break apart?
main sketch is a laaaarge file - break apart?
main sketch is a laaaarge file - break apart?

data.text:
There is now a notes/src folder that contains <foo>.md files that parallel the source code, with each file related to the associated code.

Currently, only src/sketch.md and src/color/color-system.md exist (created as color was extracted from the main sketch.js file).
consolidated-documentation has been moved into master.md or copilot-instructions.md as needed. Other general notes/instructions have been removed.
History is a ‚Äúcircular layer‚Äù collection of a fixed size. Does random get from that fixed size, or only of known populated items?

card.name: Move research and musings from Readme to notes/

data.text:
There‚Äôs a new document ‚Äúconsolidated-documentation.md‚Äù.

I am in the process of manually reviewing the other file to ensure nothing is skipped, duplicated, or incorrect.

Also, need to be user that ‚Äú.github/instructions.md‚Äù is set up to be used.

card.desc:
Was completely borked.

‚Äå

Main issue was layers not being stored correctly - there‚Äôs a cascade of issues around improper use of .remove(). I was overenthusiastic in implementing it.

‚Äå

There still seems to be an issue _some of the time._ I need to get a better handle on when/how it happens.

Transform Operations: Functions like rotateCanvas, flip, mirror, shift, and adjustGamma seem like they could form a "canvas transforms" module. Are these operations conceptually related enough to group together?

Keep them together in a "drawing modes" module, or

Split each mode into its own file (e.g., grid-painter.js, circle-painter.js, rowcol-painter.js)?
